parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
No longer, no more. Also ouk eti from ou and eti; not yet, no longer.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 2nd Person Singular
str2: Yours, thy, thine. From su; thine.
(in classical Greek: babble, chattering) speech, talk; manner of speech, dialect. From laleo; talk.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
This; he, she, it.
Truly, really, certainly, surely. Adverb from alethes; truly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
